attributes.action: Remove home address from UK Driving Licence.
attributes.background: Most people carry their driving licence and house keys together.  Having your home address on the licence is unnecessary as all information will be attached to the licence number.  It's time to end this potentially dangerous practice.

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: Consistently implement the Metric System across the UK
attributes.background: The Metric system has only been partially integrated into public life. We measure fuel in litres, speed in mph. Government policy is beer is sold in pints, while other alcohol such as spirits & wine to be sold in litres & ml. The government should implement the metric system in all law & regulation.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrepancy in selling of alcohol:
https://www.gov.uk/weights-measures-and-packaging-the-law/specified-quantities

Examples (as recent as 2000 in the UK) of where conversion errors have caused issues with infrastructure and technology:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-27509559

Inconsistency in non metric measurements - the difference between UK and US Imperial measurements:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/skillswise/factsheet/ma21impe-l1-f-converting-imperial-and-metric

attributes.action: Fund a campaign to promote the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: Plastic is fast becoming a problem that humans have caused. Damaging our oceans, infecting sea life and ourselves whilst polluting our planet on a worrying scale. We need to act fast and greatly reduce the amount of plastic being produced. We need to switch to a bio degradable alternative, hemp.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that over 12 tonnes of plastic ends up in our oceans each year. 
The plastic is appearing all over the planet, from beaches here in the U.K. To uninhabited islands in the Pacific. Not only is it choking sealife but it has become part of the food chain eventually ending up on our plate. A biodegradable alternative like Hemp plastic would stop this poison destroying our oceans and our planet.

attributes.action: Take immediate action to reduce emissions by 45% from 2010 levels by 2030.
attributes.background: The government must take immediate measures to limit global temperature rise to 1.5C, as advised by the UN's recent climate report. To achieve this, emissions need to be cut drastically in the next 12 years. Meanwhile, the government has been backing out of policies which achieve these targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Some actions should include:

-Boost renewable energy sources to 85% by 2050- (suggested in the UN report).
-Quickly phase out fossil fuels, especially coal.
-Reduce our dependance on gas and oil.
-Reinstate previous subsidies for electric/hybrid cars and ban the sale of fossil fuel cars within the decade.
-Expand and encourage the use of public transport across the UK.
-Encourage individuals to act and educate the public on sustainable living.
-Invest in technology to take CO2 from the air.

attributes.action: Not pay foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons
attributes.background: If a country possess nuclear weapons it is in no need of British charity. Donating foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons is a slap in the face of British tax payers.

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory 42 year prison sentences for using a knife against another.
attributes.background: The knife crime epidemic in the UK is out of control.  There is at present no suitable deterrent and with the increasing lawlessness and lack of visible policing, evildoers are increasingly prepared to threaten and use a knife against a fellow citizen.  Knife injuries for victims are life sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN04304

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/uk-knife-crime-police-gang-violence-stabbings-record-figures-a8589626.html

https://www.statista.com/statistics/864736/knife-crime-in-london/

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/crimeandjustice/bulletins/crimeinenglandandwales/yearendingmarch2018

attributes.action: Raise the Level of Tax free Allowance to £24'000
attributes.background: People should start paying income tax when they earn above the average national living wage.  The tax free allowance currently stands at £11'850 and from that point onwards income tax is applied.  I believe this should be increased to £24'000 to increase individual and families disposable income.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting cash in the pockets for the majority of the population should be an immediate priority for the government during this time of austerity.  This gesture would help those on lower incomes to meet the increasing costs of food & housing whilst also boosting the economy as people would have more disposable income to spend how they need.

I understand people want to contribute the society they live in and they will continue to be able to do so through our current rates of VAT on purchases.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all unpaid carers receive appropriate training
attributes.background: Adult unpaid carers save the UK economy billions of pounds each year and despite being under supported, carers are delivering cost effective day to day invaluable care and support which for most carers becomes a full time job. Carers should have a legal right to receive appropriate ongoing training
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities are charged with supporting unpaid carers under the care act. Local authorities already ensure regular routine training and support packages to other carers, I.E. foster carers, with a dedicated support team which is made available 24/7. Local authorities should be legally bound to manage, support, provide and ensure ongoing training for unpaid carers. Without certified training, unpaid carers are being left vulnerable, unprotected and isolated.

attributes.action: Ban all chewing gum except therapeutic, dental or nicotine chewing gum.
attributes.background: Chewing gum is pointless. Everywhere you look. There are small white blobs on the pavement - in schools, towns, in public transport, under tables and chairs and even in supermarkets making Britian's town's and cities a unsightly place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
The annual clean-up bill on the UK’s streets has been estimated at £150m. Some councils spend £200,000 a year cleaning up gum from pavements with high-powered hoses. Cash-strapped council's could use this money better elsewhere like Housing, transport, education, police funding AND THE NHS.
On average it costs £1.00 for an average pack of chewing gum, but it costs £1.50 to remove a single piece of dropped gum. This is a waste of tax payers money!
It also causes a nuisance in schools.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of buying beer and alco-pops 5% and under, wine under 13% to 16
attributes.background: We would like the legal age of purchasing certain alcoholic beverages to the age of 16. By reducing the purchasing of beer and wine to 16 there will be less consumption of hard spirits as well as the use of counterfeit identification. This will promote a safer way for children to experiment.
attributes.additional_details: This theory is modelled on many European countries laws; Belgium, Germany and Spain. In 2016, 7,327 people died from alcohol related deaths of which many were caused by excessive drinking of spirits. The countries current legislation promotes the use of spirits for underage teenagers to become intoxicated. So by legalising a safer alternative to consume alcohol, which is an inevitability, there will be a decrease in alcohol related medical conditions in underage teenagers.

attributes.action: Protect British food and drink in future trade deals
attributes.background: I would like the Government to act now and introduce legislation that ensures protected designation of origin (PDO), protected geographical indication (PGI), and traditional specialities guaranteed (TSG), remain a part of the British food and drink industry post Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: I urge you to back British business and sign our petition that will help promote our vital food and drink industries.

attributes.action: Pull out from and cut all UK taxpayer funding to the UN Human Rights Council
attributes.background: The Council has clearly become a platform for countries with worst rights records to whitewash themselves, as evidenced by the lack of a single resolution on the countries that run it. It is therefore a moral obligation to stop legitimising this travesty.
attributes.additional_details: According to its mission statement, UN HRC is "responsible for strengthening the promotion and protection of human rights around the globe and for addressing situations of human rights violations." It is also empowered to investigate alleged human rights abuses of UN member states. The watchdog's makeup includes Venezuela, China, Qatar, Angola, Pakistan, DR Congo, Cuba, Afghanistan and Saudi Arabia, with Somalia, Bangladesh and Eritrea most recently joining the rest.

attributes.action: Consider funding a northern bypass for Ipswich.
attributes.background: The Orwell bridge. A14. Major artery from the expanding port of felixstowe. When the bridge gets closed in either direction due to bad weather, usually high winds, or a road traffic incident. All traffic is diverted through Ipswich town which causes absolute mayhem.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-44656588

One particular day the wind brought down trees and blocked local roads which were already congested due to tge bridge closure. This particular day it took me 90 minutes to get to work, 7 miles away...! There was an idea of allowing cars only in high winds but surely that would pose health and safefy issues.

attributes.action: Remove the requirement of mandatory religious acts in public schools.
attributes.background: The Independent quotes (06/12/15) "under exiting laws, school have a statuary duty to ensure pupils take part "each school day in acts of worship."
attributes.additional_details:
The article states "While faith schools are permitted to hold acts of worship in accordance with their religious character, in secular schools the worship must be wholly & mainly of a Christian character." 

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/mandatory-christian-prayers-in-schools-should-be-axed-academics-say-a6762256.html viewed: 13th of October 2018.

In Wales and England pupils are able to opt out, but they still sit and watch.

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring on porn sites
attributes.background:
The government plans to add age verification and censoring on porn sites. 

We believe this is censorship via a back door.

We believe this will mean the UK will block many sites (just like China does).
attributes.additional_details:
It will increase pirated and probably illegal porn as it will end up only the criminals supplying porn.

We see each day sites hacked and data leaked, so we fear peoples details will be leaked online.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: To change the Gambling Act to protect minors from loot boxes in computer games.
attributes.background: Games companies are making poor quality games to maximize player spending. Players are gambling real world currency, by exchanging it for virtual currency to play built in slot machines. There are match making algorithms to match weaker players with better ones.
attributes.additional_details:
This will make the weaker player jealous, tempting them to gambling money on the loot boxes on the pay-to-win game. Gambling can be addictive, and children are more susceptible to being addicted. All the transactions and electronically automated, so children with no concept of money will keep opening loot boxes. It's a very scummy, shady tactic used by some games companies. And it's typically the case that the only thing you can buy in the game is solely the virtual currency for opening loot boxes in one game mode
 
Please sign

attributes.action: Label all ingredients (including soy oil) and create a soy tax
attributes.background: There are many people suffering from multiple food allergies, soy being one of the main culprits. It is hidden under more than 70 different names. I myself have purchased a product labelled 100% turkey and ended up in hospital because soy oil was not labelled. Allergies need to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: I have emailed the supplier of this product and all they have done is acknowledge they had soy oil in the product and offered a £4 refund. This is not enough. I was ill for a month. This is serious. Prepackaged food is over processed and has added soy in for no beneficial reason other than the fact it is a cheap alternative for the manufacturers. There is a sugar tax in action and I think there should also be a soy tax.

attributes.action: Include education on domestic abuse to the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I am a survivor of domestic abuse and violence which resulted in me losing my children. I think all children should be educated about domestic abuse so that they can identify it and so that they know it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: My experiences led me to write my experiences down and I’m waiting for a book to emerge be published. I’ve also set up a Facebook page called Parent Alienation Syndrome to help others in my situation.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all adults working with children to be first aid trained.
attributes.background: Not all members of preschool/school staff are first aid trained only a select few. Trained adults can be absent from work or out on a course or a school trip and leave the school without a first aider. This is a particular issue at lunchtimes in school when the adult ratio to children is often low.
attributes.additional_details: Children can have many complex medical needs/ food allergies. As well as everyday trips and bumps in the playground. Unfortunately acciends have been reported in the news and a recent case of a boy choking at lunchtime. All staff should be trained to avoid being left without a first aider for our children when they need one. All adults working with children should know what to do.

attributes.action: Fund non-vocational degrees for people over 60
attributes.background: The Government should fund unallocated university places for non-vocational degrees for free, or for substantially reduced fees, to citizens over 60 who can demonstrate that they would be capable of completing their courses at a satisfactory level of attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
To expand on the idea of the U3A approach and to formalise it into a higher level of attainment for those wishing to pursue academic recognition.

To explore the Chinese model of learning available to older citizens in China: 
http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/23/WS5b2d4787a3103349141de584.html

attributes.action: Set up a single tribunal service for all public services complaints/ grievances.
attributes.background: Call on the government to create a fair free tribunal body and procedure to hear complaints/grievances/appeals relating to failure, mistakes or misuse of power by those in all public services who conceal their wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact to people affected is simply being normalised and accepted as the way things are.

The public must have a right to a fair tribunal service & charter which allows their concerns to be heard when they have suffered failure/mistakes & gives the tribunal more powers to compel witnesses/public officers to testify. The public’s rights matter & they must be entitled to free access to justice & due process in disputes before an impartial judge as those in public office can use public money to conceal failure/mistakes & those affected have no voice & most cannot access legal assistance.

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Income Tax changes to be more diverse either individual or per house hold
attributes.background: Currently income tax works on an individual basis, therefore if a household has two workers at 35k they both pay 20% tax each, however in a family with children only one adult works they are penalised after 46k,
attributes.additional_details:
Council tax and other taxes work on the basis of per house hold so why not for Income Tax, changing this to a per household rate allowing partners to absorb/ utilise the tax allowance prior to the increase to 40% and/or 50%. 

Example could be: Adult 1 salary 20k, Adult 2 salary 60k tax would only increase to 40% once 80k mark has hit, this would aide families where only one parent is working and/ or coupled adults living under a single roof

attributes.action: Impose mandatory funeral funding clause upon private pension providers.
attributes.background: When my partner's father passed on, his family struggled to pay the cost of his funeral, in spite of not applying for the funeral funding payout from the job centre, which they were eligible for. We see non-UK nationals work lifelong, only to see their families impoverished by the cost of funerals.
attributes.additional_details: Families of nationals and non-UK nationals that provide an excellent service to the country are often left in a position where they cannot apply for state funeral funding because of the UK benefits system and its applications toward specific situations. Time of death cannot be predicted but private pension pay-ins are lifelong and should fund a funeral, which is the most costly part of some people's lives. The saddest day of one's life should never also be the most internally destructive.

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Fund a National Holodomor Memorial
attributes.background: The Holodomor was a famine that occurred in the years 1932-33 in what is now Ukraine. It is recognised as genocide or as a criminal act of the Stalinist Regime by 22 countries. While the undersigned support the government's decision not to join these countries, we believe it deserves recognition.
attributes.additional_details: The government has chosen (quite rightly) to construct a memorial to the Holocaust. We believe that the Holodomor was horrific enough to merit this same recognition. A memorial to those who died in the Holodomor (some 7.5 million people, according to some estimates) would serve as a message that the UK truly rejects this kind of evil in whatever form it takes, whether blatant or less conspicuous and whether from the left or the right of the political spectrum.

attributes.action: Scrap Vehicle Excise Duty and raise excise duty on fuel.
attributes.background: Instead of wasting valuable police resources chasing untaxed drivers, when they should be tackling more serious crime, scrap VED and add 10 pence to the price of a litre of fuel. That way, the more you drive the more you pay.
attributes.additional_details: We all know that manufacturer's fuel consumption figures are very unreliable. This way people will pay the fair amount due in tax based on their consumption and their mileage. It doesn't penalise the drivers who have to have a car because bus services in their rural area are non- existent and without a car they wouldn't be able to get to hospitals for appointments or to the shop for essentials.

attributes.action: Require all dog breeders to keep a correct record of Dogs chipped and sold on.
attributes.background: Today 5 Dogs caught as strays....have a chip no. but either not registered or no longer a current contact.

attributes.action: Make both GCSE English papers optional
attributes.background: I want to the government to remove English from the compulsory or “core” subjects. This is due to the fact that analysis of poems and a 400 year old play will never benefit most people in the working world. In the modern world STEM subjects are much more important and English is irrelevant.

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Create an ombudsman for the travel industry
attributes.background: At the moment when a person has a complaint regarding the travel industry the only person they can complain to is the travel member or ABTA. If there was an ombudsman appointed then the customer would stand a better chance of being helped by someone who is independent.

attributes.action: Mental health checkups should be completed yearly from a young age on the NHS
attributes.background: Mental health checkups through the NHS should be followed out just as physical health checks are done yearly from a young age.

attributes.action: Remove means testing from the student maintenance loan
attributes.background:
When applying for student finance the applicant needs to provide parental income. Based on the parental income the amount of maintenance loan available can be reduced to such an extent that it could limit the education opportunities of the student.

The current process penalises students.
attributes.additional_details:
The current process penalises students through no fault of their own and penalises where parents may have more income on paper.

The process does not take in consideration the number of siblings, the amount of disposable income, distance from home and is a blocker to University aspiration.

University drop out rates are also higher for stay at home students as opposed to those staying away. Students may be placed under pressure to stay at home due to family finance.

attributes.action: Require unused holiday pay to be paid to employees at end of every year service.
attributes.background: Many employees lose out of their full holiday pay mostly due to unable to take them depending on their job role. Employers are entitled to 5.6 weeks holiday a year. Sometimes requests get rejected by employers or can't use them all. All unused holiday play should be paid at end of the holiday year.
attributes.additional_details: I've requested holidays to be used in quiet periods and most the time I don't get them and end up losing atleast half my holiday pay aswell as many others. What's the point in entitling employees 5.6 weeks a year but they don't get the full holidays they are entitled to. These unused holidays should be paid to employees at the end of every working year as its unfair if the employer does not usage them and in turn we lose out on what we are entitled to every year.  Scrap the "don't use you lose"

attributes.action: Anti depressants should be free to everyone who suffers depression.
attributes.background: I’m calling for this to be reviewed, contraception is free on the NHS, but a person with a mental disability (depression) is to be charged for having what can’t be prevented. For people who work, prescriptions are chargeable, assuming people can afford it. This is not the case.

attributes.action: Help fund the NHS so people can have (Otoplasty-Pinnaplasty) surgery.
attributes.background:
I would like to have cosmetic surgery as my ears stick out a bit,  I’ve been to my doctors and seen different doctors and they said I might not be accepted due to funding and not have a good case.

I suffer from Body Dysmorphic Disorder and severe depression, having  ears pinned would help a bit.
attributes.additional_details:
People who need and would like to have Otoplasty surgery can’t get it done due to NHS not funded enough. It costs too much going private and either myself and/or other people who want Otoplasty can’t afford it. It’s not right that myself or others would have to go private. The cost is about £2,500-£3,500 plus any consultations etc.

I want to get this done as it’s causimg me significant Psychological distress and others feel the same. I don’t want to go privately to get cosmetic surgery.

attributes.action: Provide Network Rail with funding for the second entrance at Putney Station
attributes.background:
Wandsworth Council have been pushing for a 2nd entrance to Putney Station for years, but have failed to secure funding.

This project would improve access between SWT and District Line and reduce congestion in the main entrance. Please back this project with government funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Wandsworth Council article showing the benefits to locals:
http://www.wandsworth.gov.uk/news/article/13181/rail_passengers_urged_to_quiz_rail_chiefs_on_new_station_entrance

Local Guardian article about the plans:
http://www.yourlocalguardian.co.uk/news/10636235.Train_bosses_urged_to_consider_second_entrance_plan_for_Putney_station/

Putney High Street is also one of the most polluted roads in London, so this project would have health benefits, as well as saving time for passengers.

attributes.action: To make the M5 north and south bond to 4/5 lanes wide from Exeter to Bristol.
attributes.background: The M5 north and south bond is one of the most congested motorways in the country and each week thousands of people are stuck in heavy traffic jams turning1 hour trips into 4 hours of stand still traffic. Extending each side to 4 or 5 lanes would increase the flow of traffic and decrease congestion.

attributes.action: Create charter & new body for complaints about Local Authority Chief Executives
attributes.background: We need a new tribunal that would carry out hearings against Chief Executives in local authorities/councils who misuse their powers/cover up complaints/are awarded excessive salaries. The new body should recommend that individuals be prosecuted/sacked & recommend ways to reform the local authority.
attributes.additional_details: This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call Chief Executives/witnesses to appear, summon documents & records. Most importantly, it must include the complainants to ensure it has the confidence of the public. Currently those in our public services are able to misuse public money to defend themselves by using legal departments to cover up whilst the public face cutbacks to services. The public should have the right to challenge

attributes.action: Better Mental Health Services for Autistic Individuals.
attributes.background: Better Mental Health Services are needed for Autistic Individuals. It is important to have the right mental health services for autistic teenagers and adults to help with the stresses and strains of mental health as well as daily life. There are not enough services specific for those with an ASC.

attributes.action: Exempt all childcare for children and young people with disabilities
attributes.background: Parents and carers are required to pay VAT 20% on top of their childcare, which puts families in financial difficulties. This will reflect negatively on the family and child’s welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Child care for children and young people should be counted as a Disability service and be made Tax-Free.

attributes.action: Create a medal for those injured or killed whilst in service or on operations
attributes.background: I want the introduction of a medal to be automatically awarded to those members of the UK armed forces, and security and emergency services injured or killed whilst serving in any capacity during the course of their service or whilst on operations

attributes.action: Set up law to exempt spouse and parents of those KIA from council tax for life
attributes.background:
There is no law at present which exempts spouse and parents of those members of the armed forces, security services, NHS and police killed during their service or when on operations. 
To honour them, I want UK legislation to excuse their spouse and parents from council tax liability for life

attributes.action: Change restrictions on legal aid so that everyone can have 1 free appeal
attributes.background: Legal aid has strict criteria making it difficult unless on benefits to get free representation when convicted of a crime. The criteria should be changed allowing anyone the right to have legal aid for the appeal process regardless of people earnings.
attributes.additional_details: People that are wrongfully convicted have no chance of appeal unless they pay for representation and this can be an average cost of £5000. Most people in the United Kingdom are denied the chance due to criteria. If household income is less than £40,000 a year people should have the right to legal aid and appeals

attributes.action: Introduce Online Sales Tax to fund NHS spending increase
attributes.background:
The Government has "gifted" the NHS an extra £20bn of our money, proposed through raising yet more tax on middle and higher income earners!

An Online Sales Tax directed against Google, Amazon, eBay, Twitter etc should be used to offset tax rises for stretched families and save our high street.
attributes.additional_details:
Amazon and Google both generated £7bn in sales revenue in 2017.  A new OST of 12% (on top of VAT) would generate £1.8bn per annum alone.  Facebook did £850m in sales, generating another £100m OST for the pot.

Middle and higher income earners are not a limitless well of money for the Government to keep dipping into.  The top 1% of income earners already pay more than 28% of all income tax.  This is unsustainable in the long term and we need to reduce taxes & seek efficiency savings.

attributes.action: Recall of UK ambassador to the US in protest about detaining children in cages.
attributes.background: The United States government has implemented a policy on 06/04/2018 to separate and detain children of asylum seekers entering the US. This is an illegal and inhuman act. By withdrawing (recalling) the UK's ambassador to the US this send a strong an clear message that this is not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Since June 2018 US Customs and Border Portection have been forcibly removing children from their parents, people claiming asylum. These children have and are being detained in centres little more than cages and tented cities. The children are numbered and tagged. The US government has now opened 'Tender Age Shelters' to house babies and infants. See:

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/rachel-maddow-cries-tender-age-shelters-video-us-migrant-children-separated-parents-a8407436.html

attributes.action: Stop Water companies from draining UK taxable profits by ‘Earnings Stripping’
attributes.background: Utilities companies’ taxable profits are being drained by large foreign-owned multinationals. The profits subsidise their global monopolization and enrich the 1% high wealth investors. Government’s tax revenue destined for health and welfare is being permanently lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Multinationals reduce their taxable profits by deducting interest payments on loans held by another subsidiary located in a low tax jurisdiction.
 
The Government should change tax regulation to prevent this and should: 
-disallow for tax purposes the company’s interest expense on non-infrastructure borrowings and cap annual deduction to 1% of turnover; 
-disallow all non-UK intragroup recharges from subsidiaries/related parties above 5% of turnover.
